features.text:
Isolation Doodles is composed of three artworks that can be stitched together to form a large-scale panoramic doodle. 

Everything was changing so rapidly at the start of the lockdown, I wanted to create a piece of artwork that would evolve along with it. The idea is to add a little bit every day, as both a journaling exercise and a way to maintain a sense of routine and focus amongst the chaos. 

Some of the symbols – drawn in my signature style of clean lines and quirky character-based imagery, telling a personal story – are quite literal and mundane, whereas others represent more abstract states of mind. I wanted to include a mix of both to more accurately represent my day-to-day experience. 

The illustrations overshoot the outer edges so that I can treat the piece as an ongoing work-in-progress. I may extend the doodle and tokenise new panels later.
